intro: Guatteria diospyroides, commonly known as the Mexican persimmon, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a berry that turns from green to orange when mature, and it is edible when fully ripe. Guatteria diospyroides is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical and subtropical forests.
